snippet: The United Nations Committee Against Torture said that while there has been some progress in China, there is still a long way to go toward overhauling the system.
abstract: United Nations report says Chinese prisons still use torture, and calls for abolition of secret prisons and persecution of defense attorneys; cites retrenched abuses throughout criminal justice system despite some progress since 2008 review; human rights activists doubt sincerity of China's reform efforts.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The United Nations Committee Against Torture said that while there has been some progress in China, there is still a long way to go toward overhauling the system.

headline.main: Chinese Justice System Relies on Torture, U.N. Panel Says
headline.print_headline: Chinese Justice System Relies on Torture, U.N. Panel Finds
